selected_quotes: Luminescence, magnetocaloric effect and single-molecule magnet behavior in lanthanide complexes based on…

citation.abstract: A new family of lanthanide complexes, [Ln2(hfac)4L2] (Ln = Eu (), Gd (), Tb (), Dy (), Ho (), Er (), Lu (); hfac = hexafluoroacetylacetonate, HL = 2-(2'-benzothiazole)-8-hydroxyquinoline), was synthesized and characterized using single-crystal X-ray diffraction, elemental analysis (EA), thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA), powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD) and UV-vis spectra. X-ray crystallographic analyses reveal that are isomorphous and crystallize in the monoclinic space group C2/c. In these dinuclear complexes, each Ln(Ш) ion is eight-coordinated with two bidentate hfac and two μ-phenol bridging L ligands. The TGA results show that the complexes have relatively high thermal stabilities. Complexes and show the characteristic transitions of the corresponding lanthanide ions with ligand-related emission peaks. Meanwhile, complexes and exhibit ligand-centered fluorescence at room temperature. Magnetic measurements were carried out on complexes . The magnetic study reveals that displays a magnetocaloric effect, with a maximum -ΔSm value of 16.89 J K(-1) kg(-1) at 2 K for ΔH = 8 T. Dynamic magnetic studies reveal single-molecule magnet (SMM) behavior for complex . Fitting the dynamic magnetic data to the Arrhenius law gives an energy barrier ΔE/kB = 50.33 K and pre-exponential factor τ0 = 1.05 × 10(-8) s.
citation.journal: Dalton Transactions: An International Journal of Inorganic Chemistry
citation.title: Luminescence, magnetocaloric effect and single-molecule magnet behavior in lanthanide complexes based on tridentate ligand derived from 8-hydroxyquinoline
